post.title: Some Guys Celebrate the End of Analog TV

body:
Yeah it’s cool! I had forgotten all about this until seeing this but I was in high school at the time and remember now. It was actually kind of a big deal at the time IIRC or at least I remember o owing about it and thinking it was cool because I was into tech stuff. 

It’s also kind of crazy how dated the video and TV broadcast looks. ‘09 feels like it wasn’t that far back but I guess it’s been over a decade now.
body_html:
Yeah it’s cool! I had forgotten all about this until seeing this but I was in high school at the time and remember now. It was actually kind of a big deal at the time IIRC or at least I remember o owing about it and thinking it was cool because I was into tech stuff.

It’s also kind of crazy how dated the video and TV broadcast looks. ‘09 feels like it wasn’t that far back but I guess it’s been over a decade now.

post.title: Some Guys Celebrate the End of Analog TV

body: We’re not at the stage where everything gets shut off but we’re getting very close. Probably gonna have a mass exodus the next time the content policy changes (I predict this happening between late August and late October and the change will target misinformation and take out a ton of conservative subs). There will be a mass exodus then, then another ban wave will happen where they tighten the hate speech policy and get nearly all remaining right wing subs and some centrist ones, and at that point Reddit will be only left wingers and eventually collapse. Reddit could be completely dead at this time next year although that’s rather unlikely.
body_html: We’re not at the stage where everything gets shut off but we’re getting very close. Probably gonna have a mass exodus the next time the content policy changes (I predict this happening between late August and late October and the change will target misinformation and take out a ton of conservative subs). There will be a mass exodus then, then another ban wave will happen where they tighten the hate speech policy and get nearly all remaining right wing subs and some centrist ones, and at that point Reddit will be only left wingers and eventually collapse. Reddit could be completely dead at this time next year although that’s rather unlikely.

body: I would say at the rate they’re going they’ll be a socialist/neoliberal only echo chamber by 2022 (commies will get banned too as they’ll view them as the counterpart to the right wing subs they ban and try to pin it off as “fair” although it might not go over as well), and probably basically dead in 2024, although it’ll probably never truly die.
body_html: I would say at the rate they’re going they’ll be a socialist/neoliberal only echo chamber by 2022 (commies will get banned too as they’ll view them as the counterpart to the right wing subs they ban and try to pin it off as “fair” although it might not go over as well), and probably basically dead in 2024, although it’ll probably never truly die.

post.title: Some Guys Celebrate the End of Analog TV

body: I'm curious to see how this website evolves as the size of the community increases. I'd imagine that each mass exodus from reddit will see a corresponding mass influx to ruqqus, and my main concern is just how ruqqus is going to fund the increase in scale. We're already dealing with regularly getting 504'd, and unless there's an appropriate upgrade to the backend infrastructure, it's only going to get worse as the site effectively gets continuously DDOSed from normal use. The money is going to have to come from somewhere, and I question whether or not donations are going to be able keep up with compute costs.
body_html: I'm curious to see how this website evolves as the size of the community increases. I'd imagine that each mass exodus from reddit will see a corresponding mass influx to ruqqus, and my main concern is just how ruqqus is going to fund the increase in scale. We're already dealing with regularly getting 504'd, and unless there's an appropriate upgrade to the backend infrastructure, it's only going to get worse as the site effectively gets continuously DDOSed from normal use. The money is going to have to come from somewhere, and I question whether or not donations are going to be able keep up with compute costs.

guild.description:
Weird and interesting YouTube (or other platform) videos with less than 100,000 views. 

Looking for high-quality non-political Guilds? See +GuildsOfSubstance, a growing list of worthwhile Ruqqus non-political Guilds.

Rules: 

Videos must be older than 6 months. 

No self-promotion. 

Do not post reuploads of videos with equal to, or greater than 100,000 views.

Do not post mainstream content that has not been transformed or modified in a meaningful way.

No bots allowed

guild.name: DeepIntoYouTube

parent.body: We’re not at the stage where everything gets shut off but we’re getting very close. Probably gonna have a mass exodus the next time the content policy changes (I predict this happening between late August and late October and the change will target misinformation and take out a ton of conservative subs). There will be a mass exodus then, then another ban wave will happen where they tighten the hate speech policy and get nearly all remaining right wing subs and some centrist ones, and at that point Reddit will be only left wingers and eventually collapse. Reddit could be completely dead at this time next year although that’s rather unlikely.
parent.body_html: We’re not at the stage where everything gets shut off but we’re getting very close. Probably gonna have a mass exodus the next time the content policy changes (I predict this happening between late August and late October and the change will target misinformation and take out a ton of conservative subs). There will be a mass exodus then, then another ban wave will happen where they tighten the hate speech policy and get nearly all remaining right wing subs and some centrist ones, and at that point Reddit will be only left wingers and eventually collapse. Reddit could be completely dead at this time next year although that’s rather unlikely.
